publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2483# Mr Duncan Hamilton: Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Buteâ€”That the Parliament welcomes the recent announcement of a Citizens Advice Bureau (CAB) to be established in Argyll and Bute; recognises the excellent work of other Citizens Advice Bureaux serving not only the Highlands and Islands but also the rest of Scotland and notes that 90% of the workforce in these bureaux are volunteers; congratulates Argyll and Bute Council, the Community Fund and Citizens Advice Scotland on their partnership approach to delivering the necessary funding, and looks forward to the provision of a wide range of previously unavailable advice on consumer protection and social welfare issues that the CAB will soon provide to people across all of Argyll and Bute.
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Michael Matheson*, Andrew Wilson*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Linda Fabiani*

S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Brian Adam*
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Mary Scanlon*
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-2483# Citizens Advice Bureau for Argyll and Bute (lodged on 23 November 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
